thread.title: DC Protesters Shout ‘Get Your Rosaries Off My Ovaries’ At Women’s March [VIDEO]
thread.title_full: DC Protesters Shout ‘Get Your Rosaries Off My Ovaries’ At Women’s March [VIDEO]

author: Phillip Stucky
title: DC Protesters Shout ‘Get Your Rosaries Off My Ovaries’ At Women’s March [VIDEO]
text:
TOP Protesters attend a rally led by Chelsea Handler after the Women's March at the Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah, U.S. January 21, 2017. REUTERS/Piya Sinha-Roy 5435270 
An unnamed crying protester screamed “God loves everybody” when she came across a Christian attempting to speak to the crowd Saturday morning. 
A video obtained by The Daily Caller News Foundation shows a young protester attempting to block the man as he recited passages from the Bible. 
WATCH: 
The unnamed protester was attending the Women’s March on Washington near L’enfant Plaza in Southwest D.C. The man attempted to reason with the protester by asserting that he didn’t hate any of the protesters, he just wanted them to find Jesus. 
The young woman said the man, “is telling me to come to Jesus Christ, someone who is against everything we stand for.” Several members of the crowd came over and accosted the man. 
WATCH: 
He then screamed at the protester, to which she replied, “Where in the Bible does it say it’s OK to scream at people? Where did Jesus scream at people and accuse them?” 
He didn’t respond to the statement, instead choosing to continue to quote scripture during the entirety of the exchange. The man quickly finishes with, “You’re going to hell, you’re full of Satan.” 
The rest of the crowd chanted, “get your rosaries off my ovaries!” 
The Women’s March On Washington is the culmination of three days of protesting on the weekend of President Donald Trump’s inauguration. So far, more than 200 protesters have been arrested after vandalizing a Starbucks, a Bank of America, and setting a limo on fire. Several fires were started across the city, mostly in the middle of busy streets like D.C.’s famous K Street.
